Pre-Apocalypse[]: Nothing is known about Chloe's life prior to or as the outbreak began.
Post-Apocalypse[]: Sometime after the arrival of the Woodbury refugees to the prison, Chloe was recruited to join the community. Armed with a spear , Chloe is out along the perimeter fence taking out walkers. Part of a group consisting of Karen , David , Henry , and another man , they work methodically as a team to put down walkers and spread out any groups. At some point during the night, Chloe is attacked and killed by one of the zombified prison residents, having suffered a fatal bite wound on her neck. She is found atop the stairs by Daryl Dixon and is put down by Glenn Rhee before reanimation. Later that day, her body is brought out to the prison yard to be buried with the other deceased residents. In a flashback, Chloe is shown along the fence killing walkers with Karen, Henry, and another man. Chloe appears briefly in a flashback when Rick reflects on memories with all of his friends while panicking over the possibility that his other friends could be killed by the Saviors .
Death[]: Killed By Patrick (Infected, Indirectly Caused) One night in the prison, Patrick died from the flu, reanimated, and began to wreak havoc in Cell Block D. Zombies Chloe is attacked and bitten on the neck by one of the reanimated prison residents in the morning. Glenn Rhee (Before Reanimation) Later, she is put down by Glenn to prevent reanimation.
Killed Victims[]: This list shows the victims Chloe has killed: Nick (Possibly, Zombified) Numerous counts of zombies
Trivia[]: While this character was not credited nor was the name mentioned in the show, the writers used the name Chloe in the scripts for " 30 Days Without An Accident ".
